thinking.disposable_income: The neighborhood has a median household income around $45,000, which is below Houston's average, indicating residents are price-sensitive to transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With modest income levels and higher cost of living concerns, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity and are sensitive to both sales tax increases and transportation fees.
thinking.accessibility: The area has moderate transit access with some bus routes but is largely car-dependent, with most residents relying on personal vehicles for commuting and daily trips.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies with lower sales tax (0.5%) to minimize impact on overall purchasing power. 2) Favored moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit without excessive burden on drivers. 3) Selected lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to keep transit affordable. 4) Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts. 5) Considered that many residents are car-dependent but would benefit from improved transit options.
